title: League's "Universal Color Tier System" isn't universal (yet?).

embed.description: Hey guys, we're Riot_Mort and SpicyMemeDreamz, here to talk about some of the key design elements behind League's new leveling system. With the uncapped leveling system, our goal was to recognize and reward you for playing League regardless of your playstyle or skill level.

body:
Here they say that this  
https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/LOL_CMS_147_Article_05_g60ttsgsiy5hivceidxq.png
is League's Universal Color Tier System. It is similar to most games' tier system: white/common, green/uncommon, blue/rare, purple/epic and orange/legendary.  
Except Champion Mastery follows an entirely different color tier code:  
https://www.lol-smurfs.com/images/upload/blog/2016/08/MasteryIcons.jpg  
Gold being 1 to 4, Red for mastery 5, Purple for mastery 6 and Turquoise for mastery 7.  
And Skin Tiers follow yet another color tier code:  
https://i.imgur.com/bt4QilW.jpg  
So are the old systems going to be reworked to fit the new one or will they stay the way they are?  
If it's the latter, then is the "Universal" system really universal?  
  
Edit: As Riot Saiyaka (or just Saiyaka?) pointed out, the Honor levels follow the new color code as well as the Prestige (aka your summoner level).
